content.description: This is a really fun sport route. Makes a great warm-up. Solid rock with a little exposure (for the grade) during the last few bolts.
content.location: When facing the heart chamber, it's on the left wall. The route ascends the gray face into some black rock and onto a ledge. From the ledge, the route ascends an almost perpendicular face.

content.description:
Climb the beginning of "master and commander" through the crux. Once you pull the roof, traverse towards your left onto the face of "The Show me state"  

  Best way to link together the two of the most classic routes at stack for a full value pump. This avoids the large no hands rest and incorporates an exposed traverse on some large jugs as well as a bit more pump for those who are thirsty for fitness.
content.location: Start for "Master and Commander" then traverse into "The Show me State"

content.description: Best route at stack hands down.   Climb a 5.10 finger crack to a no hands rest, then begin climbing the steep face on good holds. The fourth fixed draw will be the reachy crux, pull past it and cruise to the desperate finish.

The anomalous start on sharp/small holds and incut feet will leave climbers wondering if they've actually started a 5.11 pitch. Hard problems separated by good holds lead to a long run to the anchor if you don't bring trad gear.  

  Pull the off the ground crux and continue up to a sweet right-angling flake that leads to some good jugs. Figure out the next sequence and then make use of a banana hammock no-hands rest to the right if you need it. Otherwise continue up the dihedral on the on jugs to a left trending run out to the anchors. You probably don't want to take that fall.    Fun three-dimensional climbing.
content.protection: Seven bolts. Pro can be placed after the last bolt and before the anchor to eliminate the possibility of a huge side swinging whipper. Not too sure of the sizes you could place, so I'm not going to guess.
content.location: To the right of 'Master and Commander'. If you are staring at the rock and thinking "How the hell am I supposed to even get off the ground?" then you're in the right spot.

content.description: Climb a mossy start to an intimidating roof. Use good jugs to pull the roof and follow chicken heads to the top.
content.location: Walk south from the Heart Chamber proper about 100 yards. The route is on a south facing wall that you must walk up hill to get to.

content.description: Climb the crack that starts The Show Me State, but continue up the vertical and slightly overhanging crack. Continue up into the roof on good but seasonally damp or wet rock to clip the shared fixed anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack for the area, I remember using some finger sized cams towards the top.
content.location: The crack start to Show Me State. Take the crack straight up to the top.

content.description:
Pull off the ground and make your way up to a dynamic boulder problem on some shallow holds. Passing the boulder problem, enjoy the no hands rest and jugs to the roof. Bring your try hard to pull the roof utilizing the horizontal seam right of the bolt. Continue up jugs to the chains. 

  One of the more spectacular pitches at Stack Rock and indefinitely one of the better 5.12's in the State.  

  Deceivingly pumpy.   Quality!
content.location: Directly right of 'Show me State'. This route could use a permadraw below the roof to aid in cleaning.

content.description: The newest addition to the Heart Chamber.This line conquers the once untraveled terrain due right of "The Show Me State"Take the first two bolts up "TSMS" and the branch right to the bolt hanging under the large Obed style roof. (This will hopefully see a long chain draw addition soon)From here gorilla swing your way out onto the arete via series of large yet easy moves. Once established onto the prow crush big holds until the 3/4 height mark where a powerful undercling crux awaits. Decipher the sequence cop a shake and keep it together before the final spicy run to the chains. Top out the cliff for full value!A must do route for the Heart Chamber!
content.location: Bolt line on the arete just right of "TSMS"

content.description: Perform a couple of bouldery moves on an overhanging start to gain the crack and chimney system. Climb and stem up through the easier wide parts, enjoying the air beneath your feet. A unique climb that gets the heart going. Rappel off a tree at the top.
content.location: Right of the heart chamber proper, below the obvious flared chimney

climbs.name: Chamber Life aka Found Your Face

content.description: Fun 5.10 face climbing to a good rest before tackling a tiered roof system.
content.location: To the right of Snack Pack (shares anchors)

content.description: The best wall at stack! Best concentration of hard, steep lines.    Sun doesn't show until noon.   Worth every step to get here!
